living in Los Angeles. My show *Gemma's Bigger Bolder Baking* is all about 
making over-the-top baking recipes that are sure to impress. This week I 
made *Homemade Ice Cream* without a machine and customized the flavor's to 
my fans' requests. What *BIG & BOLD* flavors would you create?

*Gemma's Homemade Ice Cream (No Machine Required)*
*NEW VIDEO*

comments.author: Gemma Stafford

comments.text:
+noheli lomeli Hi, I posted a S'more Ice cream recipe to my Facebook page 
if you want to check it out. It descirbes how to add in Chocolate :)
comments.author: Gemma Stafford

comments.text:
OK, I know how to do this because I made s'more ice cream using the same 
base. Add a 1/4 cup of ice cream base to 3oz of COOLED melted chocolate. 
mix together fast, then add another 1/4 cup ice cream base and continue to 
mix fast. Now that the mix is looser and you have 'introduced' the 
chocolate mix in 1 1/2  Cups of ice cream base. To this add in your bits, 
toasted nuts and marshmallows. (don't judge but I used marshmallow fluff in 
my s'more ice cream so it scooped really well and it rippled through the 
ice cream. I hope this is not too confusing. Happy baking!
comments.author: Gemma Stafford

cream thick, then add the condensed milk and you then whip for longer and 
it will actually continue to thicken. I would say just a few minutes all 
together. its hard to tell you time. Buy yeah get it thick. Also taste 
before you freeze incase you want to add more flavor. Maybe add a little 
vanilla too to contrast the cream. :)

top_comment.author: Tahmina Sultana

comments.text:

comments.author: Tahmina Sultana

comments.text:
Hi +Tahmina Sultana , thanks for trying out the ice cream. You didn't make 
a mistake. You made it perfectly. The thing with the mango puree is that it 
freezes solid so when you add it to your base it can freeze your base like 
that. I added sugar in the video to stop this from happening. You can try 
it again and maybe add more mango mixed with sugar  to your base.
The best way to enjoy this ice cream base is to mix it with the bigger 
flavors, like cookies, cake, honeycomb. The sugar in those stop it freezing 
rock hard. Also have you seen the holiday ice creams I 
made @gemsholidayicecream . I make the ice cream base in this video again 
and I tried to show it in more detail. 
Try it again, You got this! :)

ok so this is simple. When whipping cream sometimes the bottom of the bowl 
of cream doesn't get as well whipped. So you whip it, sop the machine and 
run your spatula around and you will see it is not as stiff as you thought 
 it was. then whip it up again and it will stiffen up again. Always be 
careful not to whip your cream wayyyyy to far or you will end up with 
butter :), hope this helps

comments.text:
I followed up a recipe of a couple of aussi guys who claimed to make 
perfect chocolate ice cream by just mixing the ingredients on a bowl and 
then freez it in a container. But now i see the cream needs to be well 
wiped. I actually experimented freezing wip cream by it self, and the 
texture was what you can expect from an ice cream, now that is a 
detail that a lot of people forget to mension and it seem important.
comments.author: Gio Biocampo

comments.text:
+Gio Biocampo There is a simple solution to this. What flavor did you make? 
What you add in really helps the freezing and texture. That's why I added 
cake and cookies. The more you add the easier it is to scoop. does this 
make sense?

top_comment.text:
Hi Gemma! Can u show how to make earl grey ice cream without ice cream 
maker? If I use the ice cream base u create and want to add in some earl 
grey flavour, how do I do it? Really appreciate this video :)﻿
top_comment.author: Jeremy Woo

comments.text: +Gemma Stafford Thanks so much! :) I did it and it worked!!!
comments.author: Jeremy Woo

comments.text:
+Jeremy Woo Hi Jeremy, Thanks so much for watching.  So for early grey this 
is how I would do it- In a pot heat the condensed milk gently with green 
tea tea leaves. Heat it until it is about to simmer then turn off. let it 
sit and the flavor infuse into the condensed milk. (MAYBE 30 MINUTES, MAYBE 
LONGER) Then strain out the leaves and let the condensed milk go cold. you 
can do this step the day before. I hope you get enough flavor. I think you 
will. Don't use too much green tea or the flavor might be bitter. Hope this 
helps :)
comments.author: Gemma Stafford

comments.text:
+Annastina Nyman good question. The whipped cream helps it freeze soft 
because you have the thick texture. The condensed milk stops the cream from 
crystalizing because it is laced with sugar. So you have a scoopable cream. 
best thing, it doesn't take like condensed milk or too much cream. Add your 
cookies, cakes, candy etc and you are looking at one yummy ice cream :)

Can I make a chocloate icecream using melted chocolate (I don't want to use 
cocao powder)? Do I mix the melted chocolate with the cream and then let it

comments.author: Gemma Stafford

comments.text: It totally does! Thanks! I'm going to try it this week! :)
comments.author: Narada Malawau

comments.text:
Hi +Narada Malawau , Great question. The method to do this is called 
'introducing'. It means to mix in one ingredients of different temp and 
texture into another. heres how to add ice-cream. Add a 1/4 cup of ice 
cream base to 3oz of COOLED melted chocolate. mix together fast, then add 
another 1/4 cup ice cream base and continue to mix fast. Now that the mix 
is looser and you have 'introduced' the chocolate mix in 1 1/2  Cups of ice 
cream base. When you freeze the ice cream now it should freeze hard but not 
rock hard and will be scoop able. Too much chocolate will make it hard to 
scoop. Also about not using cocoa, cocoa is used in some recipes as a 
replacement for chocolate, it is not right and you are right not to do it 
:). Does the above method make sense?

top_comment.author: MissLalwen

comments.text:
If your having problems finding cans of "Sweetened Condensed Milk", you can 
try making your own: This recipe should yield about the same as a 14oz can… 
1/3 cup boiling water, 3/4 cup sugar, 4 tablespoons (soft or melted) 
butter, 1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract and 1 cup of powdered milk.  In a 
mixing bowl, mix the boiling water, sugar and butter together by hand; add 
the vanilla extract then slowly add the powdered milk. Finnish blending the 
mixture using an electric food mixer until the mixture becomes thick and 
smooth. Cool and then refrigerate! Hope this helps; it only takes 5 minutes 
to make.

comments.text:
Hi +MissLalwen, thanks so much for watching my ice cream video. 
1, I keep my ice cream in the freezer for weeks. However if you want to eat 
it at its best then eat within 7 days. But honestly I keep it frozen for 
weeks 
2, I wonder are you describing 'Evaporated milk' and not condensed milk. 
Evaporated is like milk like what you said. Any condensed milk I have used 
has been the same as what you see in the video. It is thick like a caramel 
because it is sugar and milk boiled. You can not substitute evaporated milk 
for condensed milk as they don't do the same job. If you want, you can 
easily make your own. There are videos online. In tomorrows video I do show 
you have to make a dairy free condensed milk so you can watch that method 
using regular milk and sugar :). I hope this helps

+Sylvia MacDonald that's weird, it might be a table thing. Measurements are 
 INGREDIENTS

I do always reply fast so sorry i missed this. You can whisk it by hand 
with a wire whisk. I suggest put your cream, bowl and condensed milk into 
the fridge and get them all cold. Your ice cream will whip much better and 
faster if everything is cold. It will take around 6 hours minimum to 
freeze. Thanks for watching and for commenting. I hope your ice cream turns 
out well. Gemma. :)

top_comment.author: Lee Xinyi (Valerie)

comments.text:
+Lee Xinyi  you over mixed your cream. That's what happened. The cream 
needs to be whipped until thick and it can hold a peak. Not super thick, 
but maybe 3 times the size and light, around 3-4 minutes. Then pour in the 
condensed milk, whip it for another minutes to mix in the condensed milk 
and then you are done. Your mix now should be like stiff whipped cream. 
does this make sense?
comments.author: Gemma Stafford

comments.text: Yes! It looks like that.... Disgusting...
comments.author: Lee Xinyi (Valerie)

comments.text:
+Lee Xinyi Ok, don't worry. It sounds like you over whipped the cream. 
however the texture you are describing is a little odd. I just looked up 
Emborg cream and it looks like regular cream that should work well for this 
recipe. Can you look at this link 
http://mursapap.blogspot.com/2009/08/bbq-nite.html and tell me if your 
cream ending up like looking like the picture? If so, I know where to help 
you from here. Let me know :)

comments.text:
Hi +Lindy Williams ,Thanks you so much for subscribing. I am delighted you 
like my videos. You landed on a great one because it is my most popular. 
I can absolutely do edible cookie dough. I'll add it to my list and let you 
know when I get around to it :). For real peppermint ice cream you take an 
extra step. You can put fresh mint into your condensed milk and heat it  to 
infuse the milk. Leave it sit and go cold. When cold take put the mint and 
then make the ice cream like normal. The after you make the base drizzle in 
cooled melted  chocolate  and stir. it hardens as it hits the ice cream and 
it creates texture and crunch. Hope this makes sense :)

captions.text: (Intro Music)

(Title)
Gemma's Bigger Bolder Baking Homemade Ice Cream

Hi Bold Bakers! I got a request to show you
how to make homemade ice cream without using

an ice cream machine. Now I love this idea!
And I'm going to make it using just two ingredients.

And I'm customizing the flavors to some of
your great suggestions. So let's get baking!

You will never see me making something on
Bigger Bolder Baking that you can't recreate

with basic kitchen equipment. So today for
our ice cream all you need is a stand mixer

or a hand mixer and two ingredients--that
is it!

First, we're going to add in our cream into
our mixing bowl and we're going to whip it

on medium speed until it forms soft peaks.
When your cream is whipped, we're going to

pour in our condensed milk. Make sure you
stick around to the very end to see what great
ice cream flavors I've got coming up.

We're going to turn back on the mixer to medium
speed and we're going to beat it until it

mixes all together and it becomes a little
bit thicker.

And this is your ice cream base. How easy
is this! It tastes so good. Mmm. Yummmy.

I want to give a big shout out to gsooo1 who's
great idea it was to make ice cream without

the machine and who requested strawberry cheesecake
ice cream, which is fantastic because it's
one of my favorites.

I've broken up a slice of baked cheesecake
and I'm simply going to add our ice cream

base. Then we're just going to mix it in.
I don't like to break up the base too much

because that's my favorite part of the ice
cream. I'm going to swirl in a drop of strawberry

puree. And what we're going to do is create
a ripple effect. You don't want to mix it
in too much. Perfect!

I got these food containers that I like to
store my ice cream in. You can get these in

most food supply stores but I'm also going
to put a link in the description below.

To finish off our ice cream we're going to
personalize it with a homemade sticker. Because

that's what we do on Bigger Bolder Baking.
Now into the freezer and on to our next flavor.

Jack Pound said that his mom loves honeycomb
and her birthday is coming up so what can

I make? Honeycomb is like the inside of a
Crunchie Bar. It's really good. It's like

a really light caramel. I can show you how
to make this in the future. First break it

up using a mortar and pestle. Some bits in
big lumps and some bits a little bit finer

so you get good texture. We're going to scatter
our crushed honeycomb onto our ice cream base.

Then just gently fold it in. Because this
honeycomb ice cream is for Jack's mom's birthday,

we're going to personalize it with a sticker!
Now I'm just going to taste it to make sure

that Jack's mom will like it. Oh yeah. yeah,
she would really like this. We're going to

pop this into the freezer and onto our next
flavor.

Our next ice cream flavor is Cookies & Cream
courtesy of Mia Lopez via Pinterest and FallenAngel

on YouTube. Use a pestle and mortar to break
up your cookies and leave their fillings in

there too because it adds to the flavor. I
chose OREO because they're some of my favorite

cookies. And just like the other ice creams,
just gently fold in your cookies. I like to

leave some bits unmixed. And there you have
it, simple cookies and cream ice cream. Get

it into the freezer and onto our next BIG
flavor.

Simmi Setia is a big mango fan so for this
next ice cream, we're going to make a mango

swirl kind of like a mango creamsicle. It's
SO good! To our base, we're going to add in

some vanilla seeds and you can even add in
some vanilla extract. See all these beautiful

speckles in it. Drizzle into your base some
mango puree mixed with a little bit of sugar.

I'm going to put all of these recipes in the
description box below so don't worry. And

then just give it a light swirl. Looks so
beautiful. I think this is my new favorite
flavor because it is dreamy. Good idea Simi!

Can you guess what our next flavor is going
to be? Rainbow Cake ice cream! Rainbow Cake

was our very first episode on Bigger Bolder
Baking so make sure you check it out for the

recipe. A little bit like our cheesecake,
we're going to break it up into bits. Now

the secret is don't over mush it because you
start to muddy all the colors. And make some

pieces big and some pieces small. The thing
I like about using cake in the ice creams

is that you have the frosting on the cake
as well so you get the best of both worlds.

And then in with the base. Now just gently
fold it into the ice cream base. Because like

I said before, you want to keep all those
lovely vibrant colors. These ice creams make

great gifts. They're personal. They're easy
to make. And you can customize them to anybody's
favorite flavors.

This ice cream flavor is my personal favorite.
Funfetti ice cream! And after all my hard

work, I kind of think I deserve it. I crumbed
some funfetti cupcakes. And in with the ice

cream base. Funfetti ice cream wouldn't be
the same without the frosting. I mixed this

frosting with a little bit of ice cream base
first to loosen it up and help it freeze.

And then like any good funfetti cake--Sprinkles!
And then just mix it all together. It's like

all your favorite desserts mixed with homemade
ice cream. And I even made a label for my
ice cream so that everyone knows it's mine.

When your ice cream is frozen, serve BIG scoops
of every flavor. You'll be proud to share
all of your amazing creations.

I loved making this video for you guys. If
you have any more great suggestions, please

leave them in the box below. Don't forget
to subscribe to my channel and I'll see you

back here again next Thursday for more Bigger
Bolder Baking.

title: Homemade Ice Cream (No Machine) with only 2 Ingredients - Gemma's Bigger Bolder Baking Ep. 21
